com.petgame.ui

Class PetLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.petgame.ui.PetLoader

  • public class PetLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    The class is responsible for loading pet data from save files and checking if a pet is dead. It reads the pet's attributes from a file in key-value format and constructs a pet object accordingly. Supported pet types are: Furfrou, Tyrunt, and Magearna.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PetLoader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkDeath(java.lang.String filePath, GameManager gm)
      Checks if a pet is dead by reading its state from save files
      static void loadPet(java.lang.String filePath, GameManager gm)
      Loads pet data from a text file in key=value format into the given Pet instance.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • loadPet

        public static void loadPet(java.lang.String filePath,
                           GameManager gm)
        Loads pet data from a text file in key=value format into the given Pet instance. Lines beginning with '#' are ignored as comments.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the save file
        gm - the code used for screen navigation and game state management

      • checkDeath

        public static boolean checkDeath(java.lang.String filePath,
                                 GameManager gm)
        Checks if a pet is dead by reading its state from save files
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to store the game file
        gm - the code used for screen navigation and game state management
        Returns:
        true if the pet's state is "dead", otherwise false}.
